newsitem.title: UK: Minimal rain in eastern UK, more seen Saturday.
newsitem.headline: Minimal rain in eastern UK, more seen Saturday.

text.p: Rainfall in the eastern grain producing areas of Britain over the past day has been minimal, but colder, more unsettled weather is likely to bring rain from Saturday.
Rain last weekend and at the start of this week was too little to solve the long term problem caused by a prolonged lack of rain, farming and water industry sources in the area said on Wednesday.
Cereals crops are still threatened by the shortage of moisture, while sugar beet producers also hope for more rain.

North-east Norfolk had 1.5 millimetres of rainfall late Tuesday, a spokesman for the London Weather Centre said, but in the counties to the south -- Essex and Suffolk -- there was not enough rain to wet the ground.

A cold front is due to cross the country on Saturday, a spokesman for the Meteoroligical Office said. "It looks like it will be unsettled over the weekend," he said, with rain possible. --Christopher Lyddon, London newsroom 44 171 542 7928
